Vulnerability.Title: mdadm bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The mdadm packages contain a utility for creating, managing, and monitoring Linux multiple disk (MD) devices. The mdadm packages have been upgraded to upstream version 3.3.2, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1085533) This update also fixes the following bugs: Previously, on a system installed on Intel Matrix Storage Manager (IMSM) RAID, a spare disk could not be added to the container because the mdmon utility did not have access to write metadata to the disk. With this update, mdmon can now access the disk and the disk can be added correctly to the container. (BZ#1072979) Previously, on a system running two Intel Matrix Storage Manager (IMSM) RAID arrays, if the system was rebooted while running container reshape, the reshape did not continue after the reboot and the second RAID5 array became read-only. With this update, the reshape continues after the reboot and the second RAID5 array can be mounted correctly. (BZ#1074970) Previously, if a system running Intel Matrix Storage Manager (IMSM) RAID was rebooted during a container reshape, the reshape would not continue automatically after the reboot. With this update the reshape continues automatically after the reboot as expected. (BZ#1108027) Previously, the mdadm package installed a duplicate udev rule file, which could result in mdadm being run twice on some system events. This could result in race conditions. With this update, the mdadm package no longer installs the duplicate udev rule file, and udev events behave as expected. (BZ#1181620) Users of mdadm are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
